data.text: @jonst0kes i'm sure that's the goal.  that dip was tasty to them
@jonst0kes Similar case: https://t.co/NXe0VQZr1j Due to oil shortage, there was a partly ban on driving for example in Germany.

@jonst0kes I am imaging if prices keep increasing President Biden using the language in the 2015 omnibus bill that allows him to stop all exports of fuel, and the subsequent decrease in prices for the US

@jonst0kes "We're asking people to voluntarily do this"

"We're making it mandatory for a short time"

"We had to extend the timetable for unforeseen reasons"

"Now that you're good at it, let's agree to do it more"

"It's permanently illegal not to do this thing"
@jonst0kes "Now that we've all become experts at [thing everyone suffered through because they were promised it was temporary] we should all keep doing it for other reasons."

@jonst0kes I somewhat assumed a continuation of lockdown's, limited public spaces & remote work under a different pandemic/crisis label: climate change. Whether by policy or a side affect, seems possible.
@jonst0kes I've actually been wondering about food rationing, too. My parents were kids during WWII and they often told me how everything was rationed.
@jonst0kes Would be super nice if they restarted all our local energy production instead of buying dirtier versions of it from people that hate us.
